name: a very tiny purrl game
description:
WASD, space, esc to quit without warning

as is tradition, my birthday gift to my spouse is an artform i have never tried before

this year i have crafted: a three-dimensional video's game, using the animated purrl model they made a little while ago.  i made everything else from scratch

i made it in like a week and a half with no idea what i am doing and under the rather intense restraint of "only while no one else was around" so i didn't quite finish even my rather modest goals but oh well!!  it actually went a lot more smoothly than i expected, this is surprisingly playable

as this is a gift game and the recipient has already played it, there will be no updates ever, no matter how comically broken it may be, sorry

should i toss up the source for this somewhere?  dunno.  made with godot and trenchbroom + qodot

ps: this is for their 31st birthday, that might be helpful to know
